body.p:
Owsley County Ky
9th August 1861
Governor Magoffin

Dr Sir, John Gibson of this County was convicted and Sentenced to the penitentiary for the crime of Horse Stealing in the year 1857 his Fine Will Expire some time this fall, I was the officer who arrested him for the offence said Gibson is a young man and has a wife & four children in this county who greatly kneed his aid his wife has Demeaned herself well in society since her Husband was sent To frankfort.

Now Governor from the mannor that this man Gibson has conducted himself Since he has Been in Prison and the fact of his family kneeding his aid. & to Restore him to the privileges of a citizen again. I hope you will Extend your Executive Clemincy in his Behalf. for his good conduct since in Prision I Refere you to the officers of the Institution. he is a young man and I hope this will admonish him to never do So again if he is guilty

Your True friend
Jas Ewing Gibson
